alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Jackson; Jefferson; Perry; Williamson (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 9:30PM CDT until March 31 at 10:15PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: The National Weather Service in Paducah has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Perry County in south central Illinois... Southern Jefferson County in south central Illinois... Northwestern Williamson County in southern Illinois... Jackson County in southern Illinois... Franklin County in south central Illinois... * Until 1015 PM CDT. * At 929 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Tamaroa to near Ava to 7 miles northwest of Altenburg, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Carbondale, Herrin, West Frankfort, Murphysboro, Benton, Du Quoin, Pinckneyville, Carterville, Christopher, Rend Lake Area, Sesser, Zeigler, De Soto, Cambria, Royalton, Elkville, Hurst, Valier, West City and Ava. This includes Interstate 57 in Illinois between Mile Markers 64 and 90. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for south central and southern Illinois...and southeastern Missouri. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for south central Illinois. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
